Stuff and Blabla

Helium and balloons

6. February 2023 1 Comment on Helium and balloons
All that balloon talks going on and I can only think about my odyssey on the weekend to find lumpy 10l of Helium. We usually buy this in an industrial bottle because the one-time bottles you can get for birthday parties are‚Ä¶ meh. In costs, litres and waste of the empty can (litre litter). The 10l bottle is enough for years and several birthday parties and can be refilled. So I was puzzled when I went for a refill on Saturday just to find out that my usual dealer doesn‚Äôt have any. I was told that their dealer holds deliveries‚Ä¶

1. February 2023 7 Comments on
Due to circumstances we may have had a very tiny birthday celebration with 4 people in the car today. Usually I wouldn‚Äôt lit a candle in the car but an exception was made. Picture: a car dashboard with colorful plates and mini cakes.

Deliver Us The Moon (on Linux PC)

29. January 2023 1 Comment on Deliver Us The Moon (on Linux PC)
Played Deliver Us The Moon on Linux PC. What a ride. Took me 6h 21m to complete and I only left the keyboard twice briefly. The story had me hooked from the very beginning ü§ì Got it on GoG, installed it with Lutris and played it without a hitch or single crash [of the game *cough]. Can recommend. Thrilling, casual puzzles, some sneaking around and very thick atmosphere (without much oxygen at times).

23. January 2023 No Comments on
Endlich mal den Podcast vom @nerdgelaber mit dem @alieninvader hier angeh√∂rt: https://nerdgelaber.de/waermepumpengelaber-energiesparen-mal-anders/ Gef√§llt mir gut! Habe eine ganz √§hnliche Situation hier und gerade die Tage √ºber die Preise f√ºr Heizmaterial abgekotzt.

10. January 2023 No Comments on
üîñ https://obsolete29.com/posts/2023/01/10/how-to-setup-calibre-to-remove-drm-from-ebooks-on-linux/ I really did read a lot on the first Kindle. And I really should backup that in time before it becomes obsolete. It‚Äôs not like their current reader app is available on Linux PC anyway.

7. January 2023 14 Comments on
Working on a #TonUINO music box for/with the little one. Hot wire mess but it‚Äôs alive and plays stuff based on the #RFID put on it‚Äôs reader. Speaker is salvaged from a broken entertainment system. The rest are off the shelf modules for an #Arduino and some momentary push buttons ü§ì

7. January 2023 46 Comments on
The cat found the heating mat for my office chair. I use this because the room is hardly isolated and it makes no sense to bring the whole room to office temperatures in the freezing winter months. The mat has 3 different heat settings and is designed for car use, obviously. The important part is the pressure sensor so it stops heating when nobody is sitting on it. The cat weights enough to trigger that and enjoys it as comfortable spot to nap on now üòú

Geheimnisvolle Welt des Mittelalters

4. January 2023 13 Comments on Geheimnisvolle Welt des Mittelalters
Eyed that for a while already and got this yesterday. It‚Äôs a children‚Äôs book about medieval times with illustrations by @kristinagehrmann It‚Äôs not like most children‚Äôs books and also has chapters about uncomfortable topics, like the plague, and is apparently not full of Holywood bs. ISBN: 9783817423545

1. January 2023 12 Comments on
I may need a hair cut.

28. December 2022 No Comments on
Yikes! Gotta admit, that is catalytic converter theft something I‚Äôm very afraid of as BEV driver too. That battery has only ‚Äúsome‚Äù screws more ‚Äì and is also worth a lot more.

name: Beko Pharm
note: I dabble in programming, administration, linux, gaming, historical european martial arts, reenactment, live action role play, e-mobility, carhacking, simpits and‚Ä¶ parenting?

https://lostinawesome.wordpress.com/.title: If you cut into the present the future leaks out
